A556E6124C8D483DBA5BC7ECEF5F4931.description: Conduct a probability experiment to compare the theoretical probability (determined using a tree diagram, table or other graphic organizer) and experimental probability of two independent events.

7DEE4731D7124A7C8C7DCE038F0D0E20.description: Identify the sample space (where the combined sample space has 36 or fewer elements) for a probability experiment involving two independent events.

BE6705DC87EC44D68024B5783AC06EA8.description: Express probabilities as ratios, fractions and percents.

72E10C94014146818EDA84D9B1EE7C9A.description: Construct, label and interpret circle graphs to solve problems.

1D171B9101764E529DC057604DCDE8CA.description: Determine the effect on the mean, median and mode when an outlier is included in a data set

3B900F289D904F708EFEF608F7165E0E.description: Demonstrate an understanding of central tendency and range by: •determining the measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode) and range • determining the most appropriate measures of central tendency to report findings.

4DFF8825E8CA4D97866536D834AA4746.description: USES DATA AND PROBABILITY TO SOLVE PROBLEMS

2EDB2735E6FC48828D0157F21A9E414B.description: Perform and describe transformations (translations, rotations or reflections) of a 2-D shape in all four quadrants of a Cartesian plane (limited to integral number vertices).

7615243947A94BDE838218C01833C5DA.description: Identify and plot points in the four quadrants of a Cartesian plane, using integral ordered pairs.

42E203082DAE4A599024BEC48229B7DF.description: Perform geometric constructions, including: •perpendicular line segments •parallel line segments •perpendicular bisectors  • angle bisectors.

2C6B5398934B44108C2D0EBE3523874A.description: UNDERSTANDS OBJECTS AND SHAPES (CHARACTERISTICS, MOTION, POSITION)

E85615CFD2534516BCA5EEEC62B77F81.description: Develop and apply a formula for determining the area of: •triangles •parallelograms •circles.

8A53F8AB2E504538A82E44F28F697D7D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of circles by: • describing the relationships among radius •diameter and circumference • relating circumference to pi •determining the sum of the central angles •constructing circles with a fiven radius of diameter •solving problems involving the radii •diameters and circumferences of circles.

B8A4D0AAC6E24BB694129C805F63E4D4.description: Model and solve, concretely, pictorially and symbolically, problems that can be represented by linear equations of the form: •ax + b = c •ax = b • x/a=b, a ≠ 0 — where a, b and c are whole numbers.

AEC7AE0B652142E8BE6A453B87956D73.description: Model and solve, concretely, pictorially and symbolically, problems that can be represented by one-step linear equations of the form x + a = b, where a and b are integers.

E5D488FD0BAB4DB68CF065C7EDD185BC.description: Evaluate an expression, given the value of the variable(s).

8858A89E82CC4430AAA37162DECEF950.description: Explain the difference between an expression and an equation.

22F50A3ED2A54365AA1CD3B59FAA084A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of preservation of equality by: •modelling preservation fo equality, concretely, pictorially, and symbolically •applying preservation of equality to solve equations.

56A61BBD5A8349828C865AD9B00B6492.description: USES ALGEBRA TO MODEL AND SOLVE PROBLEMS

F0E816FDDE2C41D28BCDE947D7D4B872.description: Create a table of values from a linear relation, graph the table of values, and analyze the graph to draw conclusions and solve problems.

333A5B9AACE74227ACF2C50DD0CA1BDC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of oral and written patterns and their equivalent linear relations.

99FC6C64EF424D75A482D0FB814DEB80.description:
Compare and order positive fractions, positive decimals (to thousandths) and whole numbers by using: • benchmarks
• place value
• equivalent fractions and/or decimals.

01816402B3124320B07F9564676BC731.description: Demonstrate an understanding of addition and subtraction of integers, concretely, pictorially and symbolically

1AD2D2AE1D234664B0882692D39E65B0.description: Demonstrate an understanding of adding and subtracting positive fractions and mixed numbers, with like and unlike denominators, concretely, pictorially and symbolically (limited to positive sums and differences).

E66B3A185644480FA159C0A57040498D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the relationship between positive terminating decimals and positive fractions and between positive repeating decimals and positive fractions.

F617261C1E494C4FB06DA08D0073CADB.description: Solve problems involving percents from 1% to 100%.

5A3D20B188724486B5C7BB5D7CFC91C3.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the addition, subtraction, multiplication and division of decimals to solve problems (for more than 1-digit divisors or 2-digit multipliers, the use of technology is expected).

A6B07F4FDB5D4E67AC826A163DB6A358.description: Determine and explain why a number is divisible by 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9 or 10, and why a number cannot be divided by 0.
